head.supplied: 17 July /66 ¶ To Dr Mueller ¶ Sir ¶ ¶ I have the honor to acknowle the rect ¶ of yr note of this day's date, ¶ & in reply thereto I beg to inform you that the paragraph you refer to was written by ...

div.p: VPRS 927/P000/6, p. 131, International Exhibition 1866-7 outward letterbook, Correspondence relating to various exhibitions. VA 912 Trustees of Melborne Public Library &c, Public Record Office, Victoria.

I have the honor to acknowle the rect
acknowledge the receipt. of yr note of this day's date,
See M to J. Knight, 17 July 1866. & in reply thereto I beg to inform you that the paragraph you refer to was written by Mr Oakes who is an experienced reporter & was formerly in the Argus — after the meetg broke up Dr Bleasdale who had some business to transact with me remained behind, & before he left the paragraph in question was read over & approved by him — Mr Oakes was sitting behind the President during the whole time of the meetg & his business was solely to prepare the reports for the newspapers — I have carefully read over the accounts as published
Argus, 17 July 1866, p. 6. & I think they are substantially correct, so far as briefly epitomizing the business done — I have also looked over my own notes & I find the followg "The report to stand over for further consideration & committee to furnish estimate of cost & time of production."
